landing_page_identification: Describe the landing page type in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Focus on purpose, industry-specific elements, and traffic source. Example Output: – Lead generation, e-commerce, paid ads, minimal design.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
messaging_and_copy: Analyze messaging and copy in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Focus on clarity, value proposition, emotional appeal, and readability. Example Output: – Clear headline, emotional appeal, concise benefits, bullet points.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
visual_elements: Examine visual elements in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Focus on hero section, hierarchy, typography, and whitespace. Example Output: – Bold headline, high contrast, clean design, engaging visuals.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
cta_elements: Identify CTAs in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Note design, placement, and text clarity. Example Output: – Sticky button, red CTA, clear text, urgency.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
colours: Identify all prominent colors in the video along with their specific variations and corresponding hex codes. Include dominant and accent colors. Format as: color name (variation, if any): hex code. Mention variations such as navy blue, beige, olive green, etc. Example Output: – Navy Blue: #000080, Beige: #F5F5DC, Bright Yellow: #FFFF00.Do not start the response with any introductory statement. **DO NOT PROVIDE ANYTHING ELSE OTHER THAN THE HEXCODES AND THEIRE RESPECTIVE COLORS**
trust_and_credibility_indicators: Assess trust indicators in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Note testimonials, badges, or metrics. Example Output: – Verified badge, user reviews, success metrics, client logos.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
urgency_and_scarcity: Analyze urgency and scarcity in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Note countdowns, exclusivity, or stock indicators. Example Output: – Limited stock, countdown timer, exclusive offer.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
psychological_triggers: Identify psychological triggers in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Note social proof, storytelling, or risk mitigation. Example Output: – Trust badges, emotional appeal, reciprocity.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
alignment_and_relevance: Evaluate alignment and relevance in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Focus on targeting, personalization, and intent. Example Output: – Geo-targeted, consistent message, transactional intent.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
compliance_and_legal: Analyze legal compliance in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Note privacy policies, cookie banners, or accessibility. Example Output: – GDPR compliant, cookie banner, accessible design.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
seo_elements: Analyze SEO elements in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Note meta tags, keywords, or alt text. Example Output: – Optimized H1, target keywords, image alt text.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
footer_elements: Examine footer elements in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Note contact info, legal links, or resources. Example Output: – Privacy policy, FAQ links, email address.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
page_structure_and_layout: Assess layout in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Note grids, brand consistency, or design. Example Output: – Grid layout, artisctic design, balanced sections.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
additional_engagement_features: Evaluate engagement features in one to five words per point, separated by commas. Note quizzes, gamification, or retargeting. Example Output: – Gamified badges, interactive survey, retargeting pixel.Do not start the response with any introductory statement.
